TopicTitle: what was the most important version?

Articles.Content:
what version is the most important to you?

1) 0.17:planets

2)0.18:docking

3)0.12:Mun

4)0.14:persistence

5)0.22:career mode

that's my top five.

Edited September 1, 2014 by ratchet9868

I would say .18: Docking, the resources framework (which made stuff like TAC/Interstellar/Kethane/Karbonite possible) the modern models, electricity, maneuver nodes, close approach indicators, intakeair, fairings.
that is a point... but still new planets...

I would say .18: Docking, the resources framework (which made stuff like TAC/Interstellar/Kethane/Karbonite possible) the modern models, electricity, maneuver nodes, close approach indicators, intakeair, fairings.

I agree with this, 0.18 added a whole ton of features to the game. Maneuvers in orbit became a whole lot easier to plan and execute, action groups made ships more manageable, electricity added another dimension to design, orbital construction became possible with docking, and everything got a whole lot better looking.

After that, probably 0.12 (The Mun!), 0.14 (Persistence!) and 0.7.3, the release that started the whole thing.

It was also when KSP got more atmospheric since that was the first version with music.

Software development rules*:

  1. Version 1 is 'feature complete'
  2. Version 1.5 works
  3. Version 1.8 includes the things that should have been in version 1 but were too difficult
  4. Version 2 (the developer's cut) includes the things that should have been in version 1 but were too expensive
    • Version 2 (the developer's cut) is never implemented

[*]Version 2 (marketing) is version 1.8.1

  • Version 2 (marketing) is only implemented if there's no more money to be milked from version 1.8

[* Except EA, who will sell you an empty box and each real feature as an add-on]

Edited September 1, 2014 by Avera9eJoe
.29 It made it a whole different game. Took an amazing game to all new levels.
I say it was 0.7.3, wherein KSP first became available to the public. Without that, well, KSP would very much be vaporware.
My vote is for 0.18. It completely revolutionized how I play KSP to this day.

I've only been around since .18, but if I'd played earlier I probably would have said planets were the most important addition. The things added in the versions since .18 were certainly cool, but I wouldn't call them as groundbreaking as going from one planet to many planets.

I would have to say persistance (.14) without it we wouldn't have many of the things we use today such as docking, eva, spacestations, multiple crew, multiple command pods, large debris fields, and anything existing outside of a 2.5 radius from your ship.
I'm gonna have to say 0.14; commercial release.
